Posted By: SkyboundTerror (9/25/2012 4:37:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Don't forget: In a 4-player game, 5 points of damage to each player allows you to cast this and then [Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul) for free! In general, I can actually see using Rakdos to drop out big Eldrazi in multiplayer off spells like [Flame Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flame Rift) being a highly amusing strategy. Even without Eldrazi, there are plenty of nice low-to-middling cost artifact creatures ([Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) comes to mind) that you can just spam out as you put down Rakdos. If you're going multiplayer, some way to get flash would be really nice (so you can throw your creatures down as players damage each other)
posts.html:
Don't forget: In a 4-player game, 5 points of damage to each player allows you to cast this and then Emrakul for free! In general, I can actually see using Rakdos to drop out big Eldrazi in multiplayer off spells like Flame Rift being a highly amusing strategy. Even without Eldrazi, there are plenty of nice low-to-middling cost artifact creatures (Wurmcoil Engine comes to mind) that you can just spam out as you put down Rakdos. If you're going multiplayer, some way to get flash would be really nice (so you can throw your creatures down as players damage each other)

Posted By: LordRandomness (9/27/2012 3:03:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
Yesterday at the table next to me: Rakdos vs. Rakdos.  
  
Turn 4. Dude attacks with [Dead Reveler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dead Reveler). Girl has no blockers, suffers damage. Dude lays down... Rakdos.  
  
All around the game: "WHOA!!!" Girl looks at Rakdos: "Well, he' pretty strong..." [Dreadbore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreadbore)s Rakdos.  
  
Everyone: LULZ. Guy player looks like his heart was ripped out.  
  
Man, that should be illegal. Killing Rakdos with his own guild's supreme removal spell.
posts.html:
Yesterday at the table next to me: Rakdos vs. Rakdos.

Turn 4. Dude attacks with Dead Reveler. Girl has no blockers, suffers damage. Dude lays down... Rakdos.

All around the game: "WHOA!!!" Girl looks at Rakdos: "Well, he' pretty strong..." Dreadbores Rakdos.

Everyone: LULZ. Guy player looks like his heart was ripped out.

Man, that should be illegal. Killing Rakdos with his own guild's supreme removal spell.

posts.post_content: Are you tired of slow, bulky and ineffective creatures that cost too much to cast and do too little to win you the game? THOSE DAYS ARE OVER with the new Oxi-Rakdos! Now you can pay 4 mana for a 6/6 flying trampler and a mostly-irrelevant drawback! Watch, as I tap Racecourse Fury to give him haste and SMACK the ground-in dirt and stains RIGHT OFF my opponent's face! BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE! We've got a whole lineup of creatures you can cast for cheap due to this cost-reduction ability! He practically pays for himself, and he was cheap to begin with! Order now!

posts.post_content:
Best opening to an EDH game I've ever played:  
  
Commander is this guy.  
  
Turn one: swamp , tap-> Sol Ring, tap -> Rakdos signet.  
Turn two: Mountain, tap mountain, swamp, Sol Ring, signet, caste Desperate Ritual, cast Gut Shot for two life -> Rakdos, Lord of Riots + kicked Goblin Bushwhacker, swing for nine at empty opponent, drop Wurmcoil Engine for free.   
  
Hellbent by turn 2 in true Rakdos style.

posts.post_content:
Should have some kind of a drawback. Not being able to cast it until you lost life (as suggested by DarthParallax) would work... demons without drawbacks are just blah new age power creep great.  
  
I also don't like this card because it doesn't work well with colored symbols, and those are often the coolest cards to me. Giving this a 2/5. [Abyssal Persecutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abyssal Persecutor) is just infinitely better done, and I would say [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator) was too, even though that card was bashed for power creep. I guess people don't care any more?
